definitions.definition: Intrinsic advantages , as opposed to political or procedural advantages.
examples: I was the boss's pet project, but was rejected on the merits .

definitions.definition: Substance, distinguished from form or procedure.
examples: The merits of the case favored the plaintiffs, but their procedural blunders set them back.

secondary_definitions: Intrinsic advantages , as opposed to political or procedural advantages.
( law ) Substance, distinguished from form or procedure.
